abstract: Ratings issued by the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety reflected significant improvements in the availability of top-rated seat models at all price points.
snippet: Ratings issued by the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety reflected significant improvements in the availability of top-rated seat models at all price points.
lead_paragraph: The Insurance Institute for Highway Safety, a nonprofit financed by the insurance industry, has issued a new round of booster-seat ratings in which the organization named a record 31 seats as Best Bets, the top grade offered in the survey. Another five seats were named Good Bets; more than 40 seats received the second-lowest rating, Check Fit; while six were rated Not Recommended.

headline.main: Booster Seats Continue to Improve, I.I.H.S. Finds
